questions.prompt: What is the underlying pigment at a level 9 blonde?
questions.answer: Yellow

questions.prompt: Why is using 20 volume developer safer for on-scalp bleach than 30 or 40?
questions.answer: Lower risk of scalp irritation and swelling, more controlled lift

questions.prompt: What additive can be mixed with bleach to maintain integrity during a high lift?
questions.answer: Bond builders

questions.prompt: Explain why you should apply bleach to mid-lengths and ends before roots on virgin hair.
questions.answer: Roots process faster due to scalp heat; applying them last ensures even lift

questions.prompt: Why would tone after bleaching, even if the blonde looks bright?
questions.answer: To neutralize underlying warmth and refine tone for longevity and shine

questions.prompt: Which primary color combination makes purple?
questions.answer: Red + Blue

questions.prompt: Why does direct dye fade faster on porous hair?
questions.answer: Porous hair struggles to lock in pigment, causing quicker washout

questions.prompt: What background level do you generally need for neon yellow or pastel vivid to show true?
questions.answer: Level 9–10

questions.prompt: What’s the difference between oxidative dyes and direct dyes?
questions.answer: Oxidative use developer and penetrate cortex; direct dyes stain the cuticle layer

questions.prompt: How can you create a true smoky gray?
questions.answer: Double process toner, cancel yellow tones for true gray results

questions.prompt: What’s a quick trick to avoid overlapping bleach on already-processed ends?
questions.answer: Use conditioner, bond builder, or protective barrier on ends

questions.prompt: For vivids, why is pre-toning sometimes necessary?
questions.answer: To create a neutral base that shows the true vivid shade

questions.prompt: What’s the recommended processing time range for most on-scalp bleach applications?
questions.answer: 35–50 minutes (depending on product and lift)

questions.prompt: Why is saturating sections crucial when applying vivid color?
questions.answer: Uneven saturation leads to patchiness or dull spots

questions.prompt: Name one creative placement technique to add dimension to a solid vivid.
questions.answer: Negative space, paneling, peek-a-boo, or color blocking

questions.prompt: What’s your first step if a vivid color turns out patchy?
questions.answer: Reapply to missed areas or use a color melt to blend

questions.prompt: A bleach & tone resulted in banding near the roots—what likely caused it?
questions.answer: Applying bleach to roots that is more than half an inch grown out or uneven application

questions.prompt: A pastel vivid faded to a muddy tone. What caused this?
questions.answer: Applied over a base that wasn’t lifted/lightened enough

questions.prompt: How can you safely remove stubborn direct dye without damaging hair?
questions.answer: Use a direct dye remover or gentle bleach wash (with bond protection)

questions.prompt: A vivid red guest wants to shift to teal. What’s your first step?
questions.answer: Remove or neutralize red pigment first (fading or color remover), then pre-lighten to the correct base

questions.prompt: What water temperature is best for washing vivids?
questions.answer: Cool water

questions.prompt: Why should clients avoid sulfates after vivid color?
questions.answer: Sulfates strip pigment and cause faster fading

questions.prompt: Name two at-home care tips for prolonging bleach & tone results.
questions.answer: UV/heat protection, purple shampoo, bond building/conditioning treatments

questions.prompt: What’s an in-salon service you can offer to refresh faded vivids between major sessions?
questions.answer: Glazing/toning, color wash, or vivid topcoat

questions.prompt: How often should most vivid clients return for a refresh to maintain vibrancy?
questions.answer: Every 4–6 weeks

finalRound.prompt: Outline your step-by-step strategy for creating a seamless, long-lasting pastel pink vivid on a client with level 7 orange-blonde hair that has slightly porous ends.
finalRound.answer: 1) Consult & Prep: Strand test; discuss maintenance. 2) Lift: Pre-lighten to level 9–10 while protecting ends with bond builders. 3) Even Canvas: Use a gentle filler or pre-tone to cancel yellow for a neutral base. 4) Apply Vivid: Saturate sections evenly; process fully. 5) Rinse & Care: Rinse with cool water, condition, and seal cuticle. 6) Aftercare Advice: Recommend sulfate-free shampoo, UV protection, and 4–6 week refreshes.
